Group.name: Asylum Seekers
Group.description: Individuals who have applied for asylum and are awaiting a decision on their refugee status.

Group.name: Refugees
Group.description: People who have been granted protection under the 1951 Refugee Convention.

Group.name: Unaccompanied Minors
Group.description: Children under 18 who arrive in a country without a legal guardian.

Group.name: Women Refugees
Group.description: Female refugees, often facing gender-specific challenges and vulnerabilities.

Group.name: Disabled Refugees
Group.description: Refugees with physical or mental disabilities requiring specialized support.

Group.name: LGBTQ+ Refugees
Group.description: Refugees fleeing persecution based on sexual orientation or gender identity.

Group.name: Stateless Persons
Group.description: Individuals who do not have a recognized nationality and are without legal protection.

Group.name: Families
Group.description: Family units seeking asylum together, often with children.

Group.name: War Refugees
Group.description: Individuals fleeing armed conflict in their home country.

Group.name: Political Refugees
Group.description: Refugees fleeing persecution due to political beliefs or activism.

Group.name: Ethnic Minority Refugees
Group.description: Members of ethnic minorities facing persecution and seeking refuge.

Group.name: Religious Minority Refugees
Group.description: Individuals fleeing persecution based on their religious beliefs.

Group.name: Trafficking Survivors
Group.description: Individuals who have been victims of human trafficking and are seeking protection.

Group.name: Health Vulnerable Refugees
Group.description: Refugees with chronic illnesses or medical conditions requiring care.

Group.name: Refugee Elderly
Group.description: Elderly refugees who require special care and support due to their age.

Group.name: Students in Exile
Group.description: Refugee students seeking education and support in a new country.

Group.name: Subsidiary Protection Beneficiaries
Group.description: Individuals granted protection due to risk of serious harm in their home country.

Group.name: Internally Displaced Persons
Group.description: People forced to flee their homes but remain within their country's borders.

Group.name: Climate Refugees
Group.description: Individuals displaced due to environmental disasters or climate change.

Group.name: Pregnant Women
Group.description: Vulnerable group of women seeking asylum while pregnant.

Group.name: Victims of Torture
Group.description: Survivors of torture seeking refuge from further harm.

Group.name: Asylum Seekers from Safe Countries
Group.description: Asylum seekers from countries deemed 'safe,' often facing accelerated procedures.

Group.name: Single Mothers
Group.description: Mothers seeking asylum while raising children alone.

Group.name: Refugees with PTSD
Group.description: Refugees suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder due to their experiences.

Group.name: Sexual Violence Survivors
Group.description: Survivors of sexual violence seeking asylum and support.

Group.name: Disabled Asylum Seekers
Group.description: Asylum seekers with disabilities who require specialized assistance.

Group.name: Refugees with Chronic Illnesses
Group.description: Refugees managing chronic health conditions requiring ongoing treatment.

Group.name: Women Asylum Seekers
Group.description: Female asylum seekers facing gender-specific challenges.

Group.name: Victims of Domestic Violence
Group.description: Individuals fleeing domestic abuse seeking protection and asylum.

Group.name: Child Refugees
Group.description: Children who have been granted refugee status.

Group.name: Victims of Female Genital Mutilation (FGM)
Group.description: Survivors of FGM seeking asylum to escape further harm.

Group.name: Refugees from Failed States
Group.description: Individuals fleeing countries where the government has collapsed, leading to instability.

Group.name: Persons with Precarious Status
Group.description: Individuals with uncertain legal status, often at risk of deportation.

Group.name: Elderly Asylum Seekers
Group.description: Older individuals seeking asylum who require age-related support.

Group.name: Refugees Fleeing Genocide
Group.description: Individuals escaping genocide in their home country.

Group.name: Victims of Violence
Group.description: Individuals seeking asylum after experiencing violence.

Group.name: Refugees with Special Needs
Group.description: Individuals requiring special care due to physical or mental conditions.

Group.name: Unaccompanied Girls
Group.description: Female minors arriving without a guardian, often facing additional risks.

Group.name: Victims of Slavery
Group.description: Individuals escaping modern slavery, seeking asylum and protection.

Group.name: Victims of Human Rights Abuses
Group.description: Individuals fleeing severe human rights violations in their home country.

Group.name: Migrants in Transit
Group.description: Individuals on their way to a final destination, often stuck in limbo.

Group.name: Refugees with Mental Disabilities
Group.description: Refugees with cognitive impairments requiring mental health support.

Group.name: Unaccompanied Boys
Group.description: Male minors arriving without a guardian, facing vulnerabilities.

Group.name: Ethnic Refugees
Group.description: Members of ethnic groups seeking refuge due to persecution.

Group.name: Cultural Minority Refugees
Group.description: Refugees fleeing persecution based on cultural practices or identity.

Group.name: Victims of Hate Crimes
Group.description: Individuals fleeing targeted violence based on identity.

Group.name: Refugees from Conflict Zones
Group.description: Individuals fleeing ongoing armed conflict in their home regions.

Group.name: Victims of War Crimes
Group.description: Individuals fleeing war zones where international laws have been violated.

Group.name: Refugees with HIV
Group.description: Refugees living with HIV, requiring access to healthcare and support.

Group.name: Asylum Seekers with Special Needs
Group.description: Asylum seekers with disabilities or health conditions requiring special care.
